title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.28 - Photograph requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.28 - Photograph requirements

State Regulations
(a) An
appearance enhancement practitioner shall affix his/her photograph (containing
only the head and full face) to the license in the appropriate space indicated, and subscribe beneath or alongside the photograph the date it was taken. A
photograph on a license cannot be more than four years old. (b) A business licensee shall have affixed to
the license a 1 1/2" x 11/2" photograph of the person who owns or manages the
business (containing only the head and full face) with a subscription beneath
or alongside the photograph indicating the date it was taken. A photograph on a
license cannot be more than four years old. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
160.28

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
